alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 8:37AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE LOWER KUSKOKWIM RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by storm surge is expected. * WHERE...The lower Kuskokwim River, including Bethel, Napakiak, and other nearby villages. * WHEN...Until 345 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 AM AKDT, Water levels remain high from strong winds and associated storm surge from the storm that moved through the last couple days. Although water levels have fallen overnight and this morning, water levels will rise once again with today`s high tide. They will not be as high as on Saturday, but will still cause minor flooding of low lying areas in villages along the lower Kuskokwim River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
